title: Astaroth
data:
**Astaroth, the Broken Clockmaker** is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Ritual, seal and taboo](#Ritual.2C_seal_and_taboo)

- [2 Mark](#Mark)

- [3 Benefits](#Benefits)

- [4 As a monster](#As_a_monster)

  - [4.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [4.2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Ritual, seal and taboo

An [eroded](/wiki/Eroded "Eroded") item must be placed in Astaroth's seal - the item is repaired as part of the ritual, and any negative [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") is also fixed. If binding him into [the Pen of the Void](/wiki/The_Pen_of_the_Void "The Pen of the Void"), the Pen itself must be rusty or corroded.

To remain bound to Astaroth, a character must not deliberately break inventory items, including [mulching](/wiki/Mulching "Mulching") ammunition - breaking non-inventory items such as [doors](/wiki/Door "Door") and [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars") is permitted.

## Mark

A character that has Astaroth bound weeps tears of black oil - these can be easily seen from a distance, and the character must wear a [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold"), [towel](/wiki/Towel "Towel") or a [mask](/wiki/Mask_\(dNetHack\) "Mask (dNetHack)") to keep them hidden.

## Benefits

While bound, Astaroth confer [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") and [magical breathing](/wiki/Magical_breathing "Magical breathing"), and grants skill in [crossbows](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow") and [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken").

Astaroth's active powers are as follows:

- **Astaroth's Assembly**: Projects an invisible beam up to 5 spaces in the chosen direction, creating a [shocking](/wiki/Shock "Shock") explosion centering on the first target struck. This explosion loses 1 die of damage for each [square](/wiki/Square "Square") the beam travels, with a minimum of 1 die and a maximum of 5 dice. The character then gains 1 point of extrinsic [protection](/wiki/Protection "Protection") similar to [the spell](/wiki/Spellbook_of_protection "Spellbook of protection") for each square that the beam travels without exploding, up to a maximum of 5 points - this protection decreases by 1 point every 5 turns.
- **Astaroth's Shards**: Fires a barrage of shuriken equal to the character's spirit die size + XL/10 + 1 along random ranks, and the character takes damage equal to their spirit die size. The barrage may be concentrated by activating it while standing in a corridor or other narrow space.

His passive powers are as follows:

- **Rusting**: The character takes 1 damage per turn from being underwater.

## As a monster

| & Astaroth *(No tile)*                                          |                                         |
| --------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")** | 15                                      |
| **Attacks**                                                     | Weapon 4d5 physical, tinker 0d0 tinkers |
|                                                                 |                                         |

| & Astaroth *(No tile)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                                                         |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | 15                                                      |
| **Attacks**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | Weapon 4d5 physical, tinker 0d0 tinkers                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                         |
| **Base [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | 13                                                      |

| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | 0 (Not randomly generated)                              |
| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | No                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                         |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | 3000                                                    |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | 400                                                     |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | large                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                         |
| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire"), [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock") |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                         |
| Astaroth:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [demon](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").
* is male.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* resists death magic.
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                         |

In notdNetHack, **Astaroth**, &, also appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that can be summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder"). He is a [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") [demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), will pick up and collect other items, and can [follow](/wiki/Follow "Follow") a character to other levels if he is adjacent.

Astaroth has a weapon attack and will create hostile [gizmos](/wiki/Gizmo "Gizmo") during each of his turns if he is close enough to the target - the gizmo created will be a [firework cart](/wiki/Firework_cart "Firework cart") 1⁄10 of the time, and will otherwise be a [clockwork soldier](/wiki/Clockwork_soldier "Clockwork soldier"), [clockwork dwarf](/wiki/Clockwork_dwarf "Clockwork dwarf") or [faberge sphere](/wiki/Faberge_sphere "Faberge sphere"), with an equal probability of each. He possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") and [death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance").

Astaroth is poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if he is [digested](/wiki/Digest "Digest") by another monster. Like many summoned spirits, Astaroth cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame").

### Generation

Astaroth is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Astaroth is [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") 2-3 [upgrade kits](/wiki/Upgrade_kit "Upgrade kit").

Astaroth [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

### Strategy

**Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.** They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

[x][ ]

- Strategy
- Role spoiler

Astaroth can hit hard in melee, but this is somewhat manageable - the automatons he creates may be somewhat more pressing to deal with.

Astaroth can be encountered again in the [Void](/index.php?title=Void\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Void (page does not exist)"), which is accessed by opening the high [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of [Ilsensine the Fallen](/wiki/Ilsensine_the_Fallen "Ilsensine the Fallen") as an Illithanachronounbinder using the [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") effect of [The Elder Cerebral Fluid](/wiki/The_Elder_Cerebral_Fluid "The Elder Cerebral Fluid"). Astaroth is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving").

## Encyclopedia entry

He is very old. He is hurting very badly. He is underwater, in space, and everywhere else. He cannot get off his chair. He is stuck there forever because he is so badly hurt.

\[ SCP-1348, SCP Foundation ]

…not afraid of The Lord, for He is as we are, broken and scattered. As we restore the body of God, so we restore ourselves. To join with the Lord is good. As we give honor and worship to the Lord, so does He honor us. To serve the Lord is good. As we guard the Lord from harm, so does He…

\[ Church of the Broken God Bible Fragments, SCP Foundation ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Astaroth

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Astaroth, the Broken Clockmaker is a spirit that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Ritual, seal and taboo
  • 2 Mark
  • 3 Benefits
  • 4 As a monster
    • 4.1 Generation
    • 4.2 Strategy
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry

Ritual, seal and taboo

An eroded item must be placed in Astaroth's seal - the item is repaired as part of the ritual, and any negative enchantment is also fixed. If binding him into the Pen of the Void, the Pen itself must be rusty or corroded.

To remain bound to Astaroth, a character must not deliberately break inventory items, including mulching ammunition - breaking non-inventory items such as doors and iron bars is permitted.

Mark

A character that has Astaroth bound weeps tears of black oil - these can be easily seen from a distance, and the character must wear a blindfold, towel or a mask to keep them hidden.

Benefits

While bound, Astaroth confer shock resistance and magical breathing, and grants skill in crossbows and shuriken.

Astaroth's active powers are as follows:

  • Astaroth's Assembly: Projects an invisible beam up to 5 spaces in the chosen direction, creating a shocking explosion centering on the first target struck. This explosion loses 1 die of damage for each square the beam travels, with a minimum of 1 die and a maximum of 5 dice. The character then gains 1 point of extrinsic protection similar to the spell for each square that the beam travels without exploding, up to a maximum of 5 points - this protection decreases by 1 point every 5 turns.
  • Astaroth's Shards: Fires a barrage of shuriken equal to the character's spirit die size + XL/10 + 1 along random ranks, and the character takes damage equal to their spirit die size. The barrage may be concentrated by activating it while standing in a corridor or other narrow space.

His passive powers are as follows:

  • Rusting: The character takes 1 damage per turn from being underwater.

As a monster

& Astaroth (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks Weapon 4d5 physical, tinker 0d0 tinkers
& Astaroth (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks

Weapon 4d5 physical, tinker 0d0 tinkers

Base level 13
Base experience 452
Speed 14
Base AC 5
Base MR 40
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 400
Size large
Resistances fire, shock

Astaroth:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a demon.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • cannot be tamed.

In notdNetHack, Astaroth, &, also appears as a monster that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is a humanoid demon that can be seen via infravision, will pick up and collect other items, and can follow a character to other levels if he is adjacent.

Astaroth has a weapon attack and will create hostile gizmos during each of his turns if he is close enough to the target - the gizmo created will be a firework cart 1⁄10 of the time, and will otherwise be a clockwork soldier, clockwork dwarf or faberge sphere, with an equal probability of each. He possesses fire resistance, shock resistance and death resistance.

Astaroth is poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if he is digested by another monster. Like many summoned spirits, Astaroth cannot be tamed.

Generation

Astaroth is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Astaroth is generated with 2-3 upgrade kits.

Astaroth does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role. They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

Astaroth can hit hard in melee, but this is somewhat manageable - the automatons he creates may be somewhat more pressing to deal with.

Astaroth can be encountered again in the Void, which is accessed by opening the high altar of Ilsensine the Fallen as an Illithanachronounbinder using the invoke effect of The Elder Cerebral Fluid. Astaroth is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him nonliving.

Encyclopedia entry

He is very old. He is hurting very badly. He is underwater, in space, and everywhere else. He cannot get off his chair. He is stuck there forever because he is so badly hurt.

[ SCP-1348, SCP Foundation ]

…not afraid of The Lord, for He is as we are, broken and scattered. As we restore the body of God, so we restore ourselves. To join with the Lord is good. As we give honor and worship to the Lord, so does He honor us. To serve the Lord is good. As we guard the Lord from harm, so does He…

[ Church of the Broken God Bible Fragments, SCP Foundation ]

rawPage:
'''Astaroth, the Broken Clockmaker''' is a [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirit]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]].

==Ritual, seal and taboo==
An [[eroded]] item must be placed in Astaroth's seal - the item is repaired as part of the ritual, and any negative [[enchantment]] is also fixed. If binding him into [[the Pen of the Void]], the Pen itself must be rusty or corroded.

To remain bound to Astaroth, a character must not deliberately break inventory items, including [[mulching]] ammunition - breaking non-inventory items such as [[door]]s and [[iron bars]] is permitted.

==Mark==
A character that has Astaroth bound weeps tears of black oil - these can be easily seen from a distance, and the character must wear a [[blindfold]], [[towel]] or a [[Mask (dNetHack)|mask]] to keep them hidden.

==Benefits==
While bound, Astaroth confer [[shock resistance]] and [[magical breathing]], and grants skill in [[crossbow]]s and [[shuriken]].

Astaroth's active powers are as follows:

* '''Astaroth's Assembly''': Projects an invisible beam up to 5 spaces in the chosen direction, creating a [[shock]]ing explosion centering on the first target struck. This explosion loses 1 die of damage for each [[square]] the beam travels, with a minimum of 1 die and a maximum of 5 dice. The character then gains 1 point of extrinsic [[protection]] similar to [[Spellbook of protection|the spell]] for each square that the beam travels without exploding, up to a maximum of 5 points - this protection decreases by 1 point every 5 turns.
*'''Astaroth's Shards''': Fires a barrage of shuriken equal to the character's spirit die size + XL/10 + 1 along random ranks, and the character takes damage equal to their spirit die size. The barrage may be concentrated by activating it while standing in a corridor or other narrow space.

His passive powers are as follows:

* '''Rusting''': The character takes 1 damage per turn from being underwater.

 |reference=

In notdNetHack, '''Astaroth''', {{red|&}}, also appears as a [[monster]] that can be summoned by an [[Illithanachronounbinder]]. He is a [[humanoid]] [[Major demon|demon]] that can be seen via [[infravision]], will pick up and collect other items, and can [[follow]] a character to other levels if he is adjacent.

Astaroth has a weapon attack and will create hostile [[gizmo]]s during each of his turns if he is close enough to the target - the gizmo created will be a [[firework cart]] {{frac|10}} of the time, and will otherwise be a [[clockwork soldier]], [[clockwork dwarf]] or [[faberge sphere]], with an equal probability of each. He possesses [[fire resistance]], [[shock resistance]] and [[death resistance]].

Astaroth is poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if he is [[digest]]ed by another monster. Like many summoned spirits, Astaroth cannot be [[tame]]d.

===Generation===
Astaroth is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [[polymorph]].

Astaroth is [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] 2-3 [[upgrade kit]]s.

Astaroth [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

===Strategy===
'''Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.''' They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

Astaroth can hit hard in melee, but this is somewhat manageable - the automatons he creates may be somewhat more pressing to deal with.

Astaroth is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him [[nonliving]].
